No. CAS-18066/1/2021-OPS DIV- BCAS-Part (2); Date:- 19/10/2024

In view of the Global scenario of heightened Security & Bomb threats continuous to

the Civil Aviation Sector , it is necessary to enhance the existing security measures being
taken at all the Civil Aviation Installations in the country like airports, airstrips, airfields, Air
force stations, helipads, flying schools, aviation training institutes etc. so that no untoward
incident takes place during the festive season . Utmost precautions need to be taken by all
the stake holders which may inter-alia include the following measures:

i.

ii.

iii.

vi.

Ensuring 100% serviceability of all CCTVs of Airports.

Strict on-ground monitoring of regulatory guidelines for operations
of non-conventional aerial platform like Microlite aircrafts, Aero
models, Para glider, Unmanned Aerial Systems(UAS), Drones,
power hang gliders and hot air balloons.

Strengthening of anti-terrorism/ Anti-sabotage measures.

Placement of QRT at all the airports and rehearsals by QRTs and
patrolling parties regularly.

Intensive checking of vehicles/ persons at the approach (NAKA) to
airport terminals/ installations.

In terms of BCAS Avsec Cir no 4/2024 , compulsory 10% of
Secondary Ladder Point Checking (SLPC) of all the flights at
4:
all the airports. However, J&K and North Eastern state
Airports continues with usual regulations in terms of SLPC.
Enhanced surveillance in and around the aviation installatio
Enhanced surveillance on the ground handling staff.

ix. Strict monitoring of non-scheduled flight operations including air
ambulance.

x. Enhanced security measures and surveillance at cargo terminals.
xi. Enhanced security and surveillance in parking areas of airports.

2. All Airport Director/CSOs shall convene special APSC meeting and
advise all concemed agencies to take all possible precautionary measures to
preclude possibility of any act of unlawful interference with civil intimation to
the concerned BCAS regional offices. All Regional Directors, BCAS to ensure
special APSC meetings are conducted at all airports in their respective
jurisdiction immediately.

3. This advisory is valid for next 30 days from the date of issue.
